title: Message Keyboards
description: A keyboard can be added to a message in order to offer a set of options to the user:

children.value: A keyboard can be added to a message in order to offer a set of options to the user:
A keyboard can be added to a message using the
has a fluent way to define its buttons and other properties (rows, button chunking, etc.):
buttons can be set up using the
method and are defined as a
Additionally, a keyboard can be added to a message using a closure:
can be defined using its fluent methods and can be of three types:
to be handled by a custom webhook
and are used to open an external url when pressed:
and are used to start a telegram bot
and are used to start a telegram widget

Pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats,
open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query
in the input field. The query text may be empty, in which case just the
bot's username will be inserted. (see

Additionally, an inline query button may act for the current chat
(so, would skip the destination chat prompt) only if
A keyboard will normally place one button per row, this behaviour can be customized by defining rows, by setting individual buttons width or by chunking buttons
A button relative width can be set using a float number the total width percentage to be taken. Buttons will flow through the rows according to their width
this example would define two buttons on the first row and a large button on the second one:
A button default width is 1 (that's to say, the entire row width)
Each width is defined as a float between 0 and 1 that represents the floating point percentage of the row taken by the button.
each button will fill the current row or flow in the subsequent one if there isn't enough space left
Buttons can be authomatically chunked in rows using the
This example would return a first row of two buttons, a second row of two buttons and the last row with the remaining button.
A message keyboard can be replaced by a new one by submitting its
A keyboard can be removed from a message by submitting its
method allows to execute a closure when the given condition is verified
method allows to change buttons layout from left-to-right to right-to-left (RTL).

html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}
